intro: Macrozanonia clarkei, commonly known as the Clarke's macrozanonia, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or savanna habitats.
